name: terrestrially
content:
terrestrially adverb
(EARTH)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to the earth, or to being, living, or moving on the ground: Because of my partner's fear of flying, we'll be making the trip terrestrially, 28 hours by car. The creatures were able to move themselves terrestrially without needing to float in water.
More examplesFewer examplesUntil the aeroplane was invented, humans were terrestrially bound and could never see what the earth looked like from high above.

terrestrially adverb
(BROADCASTING)
in a way that relates to the broadcasting of television and radio channels using equipment that is on the ground and not on satellites: Most viewers receive the broadcast terrestrially, but there are a few overseas viewers who watch it via satellite. The show is not yet available terrestrially to local cable subscribers.
